The current [C# project](https://github.com/mozilla/glean/blob/cc28d5106f90f1eed20334b8e38c6e619f569776/glean-core/csharp/csharp/Glean.csproj#L16) picks the "glean_ffi.dll" debug library and packs it in the nuget package for its consumers.

This approach does not work for multiple reasons:

- the artefact to use depends on the platform (e.g. .so libraries on linux)
- it only packs one dll in the final nuget package, which means we'd need a package for each target architecture.

We should fix that.
